name: Tracking Compromised Individuals
description: Identifying key figures under blackmail-based control and analyzing their behavioral patterns.

cards.title: Behavioral Red Flags of Coercion
cards.description: Signs that an individual is operating under external control.
bulletpoints: Sudden shifts in policy or behavior that contradict previous stances.
Uncharacteristic compliance with elite agendas despite public opposition.
Increased secrecy, unusual alliances, and avoidance of direct questioning.
cards.summaryText: Spot coerced shifts, elite-friendly compliance, and the secrecy that screams external control.

cards.title: Network Mapping of Blackmail Rings
cards.description: How to track and expose groups connected through shared compromise.
bulletpoints: Using financial records and unusual wealth shifts to trace corruption.
Identifying gatekeepers and handlers controlling compromised assets.
Analyzing leaked data and whistleblower testimony to establish links.
cards.summaryText: Follow the money, identify the handlers, and connect leaks to map blackmail rings.

cards.title: Predicting Resignations and Power Shifts
cards.description: How internal pressure leads to unexpected exits and betrayals.
bulletpoints: Recognizing forced resignations due to leverage expiration or exposure.
Tracking sudden media narratives as preemptive damage control.
Identifying scapegoat strategies to divert attention from larger networks.
cards.summaryText: Forecast exits by watching leverage expire, narratives spin, and scapegoats take the fall.
